data.Title: Open project dialog in Windows 10
data.Content:
Hi,
I'm using Language Manager 4.14 under Windows 10. I have an issue concerning the usage of your application. When clicking the File|Open Project menu item, I get the Windows dialog to select the project to open. Well, ever since I switched my OS from Windows 7 to Windows 10, the displayed content is no more the previous project worked on but the default Language Manager project (\KLIB\localizer\langmngr\langmngr.ntv.lng). This is an issue concerning the operating system, that I know for sure.

My question: can you provide a workaround to fix this?

Thanks!

</Columns>

-<Condition class="SMPL" readOnly="False" enabled="True">

```

</Expressions>
</Condition>
-<Condition class="PDCT" linking="Any" readOnly="False" enabled="True">
-<Condition class="SMPL" readOnly="False" enabled="True">

-<Condition class="SMPL" readOnly="False" enabled="True">

```

```

data.Title: Adding extra column and preforming custom sorting on results
data.Content:
Support
I have some questions regarding output needs.
#1: How can I add an extra column to a specific query without editing the data model?  This column is not a physical column in the model, but is instead a placeholder field for a select statement I use to dynamically execute sql in a sp.  I tried to add the column client-side in code, but it seems to want me to associate with a real table.column in model; as it associates it with gregorian date.  I tried to update the model xml after this just to see if I could get it to work, and it did, but it shows up in the entities panel - not what we want).
#2: How can I control the order of the extra column in the query?  Can it be added by position?
#3: How can I control sorting of results? I dont sort in sp due to performance concerns, so I need to sort either in server or client - after I get the results back from db.
I tried to research how to do this online and I cant find much...
Thanks.
Jeff Scarleski

data.Title: Same Criteria Across Multiple Columns
data.Content:
Hello,
I was wondering if there was a way to configure Easy Query to query multiple columns with the same criteria entered from the builder without the user having to build the complete query.
Example:
A table has 5 columns, an ID and 4 columns containing codes called Code1, Code2, Code3, and Code4.  In the builder I only want the user to have to enter in one code and have it check to see if any of the code columns contain the entered code.  So if any of the code columns (Code1 to Code4) contain the value, the row is returned.  I know this can be built by the user but I was wondering if there was an easier way.
Thank you,
- Matt
Matthew.Miller@lexisNexisRisk.com

data.Title: Korzh.Utils.Db.DbExport.ExportToCsv
data.Content:
We are currently using your assembly to export some data to CSV formated file.
Here is the part of code:
```
    var csvFormat = CsvFormats.Default;
    csvFormat.Separator = ";";
    DbExport.ExportToCsv(reportDataTable, Response.Output, csvFormat);
```
The export is quite good expect when there is both " and ; characters in a same data.
Example of file content:
```
    SEP=;
    COLUMN
```
    "This is a test of quote \" and ; in the same data field."
Khorz library replace " by \" instead of doubling the quotes like this "" ([stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4617935/is-there-a-way-to-include-commas-in-csv-columns-without-breaking-the-formatting))
Here is a correct version of file content:
```
    SEP=;
    COLUMN
```
    "This is a test of quote "" and ; in the same data field."
Do you have a fixed version of the library ?
```
*Assembly: Korzh.Utils.Db.NET45 (Version=3.7.1.69)*

data.Title: SQLite - Right joins
data.Content:
Hi,
I'm using left joins in my model which sometimes generates query with right join - depending on table order. Problem is that SQLite I'm using does not support right joins. I thought this can be solved using table priorities to always have the tables in the correct order. But still it doesn't work as expected. Example

Result columns:
tableA.ColA  
tableC.ColC

Generated SQL:   
```
SELECT tableA.ColA, tableC.ColC
FROM tableC
     RIGHT OUTER JOIN tableB ON (tableB.tableCId  = tableC.Id )
     LEFT OUTER JOIN tableA ON (tableB.tableAId  = tableA.Id )
```

Table priorities:   
tableA = 1000
tableB = 50
tableC = 100

So I would expect the table order in the query to be tableB, tableC, tableA. Then the right join would be eliminated. But it doesn't work that way.

Can you please have a look on it?

Regards
Ondřej

Seems like quotes are used to generate parameter name and then replaced by _. Not a big deal, just cosmetic bug I think.
Regards
Ondřej

data.Content:
Hi Sergiy,
I have a question relate to a GROUP BY clause. I need to achieve the following query but without luck.
```
Select
	Count(AccountId)
FROM
	(SELECT
		  [AccountId] as AccountId		
		  ,Count(*) as Trips
		  ,min([Date]) as MinDate
		  ,max([Date]) as MaxDate
	  FROM [dbo].[Events]
	  where Discriminator = 'Validation' and ValidationType = 1 and Reason in (3,4, 9,10,11,12) and Events.[Date] BETWEEN '2019-11-04 00:00' AND '2019-11-10 00:00'
	  group by AccountId
	  ,  DATEPART(YEAR, [Date]),
						  DATEPART(MONTH, [Date]),
						  DATEPART(DAY, [Date]),
						  DATEPART(HOUR, [Date])
						  ) G
group by G.AccountId
```
In other words, I need to select from subquery which is result from other select based on group by clauses.
```
SELECT
```
AGREGATE
```
FROM
```
(SELECT Id, SUM(*) FROM Table GROUP BY Id)
```
GROUP BY AccountId
```
Can I achieved this one using EasyQuery .NET Core and EasyQuery JS?
Thanks in advanced,
```
Ivelina

data.Title: Bug in the NONE condition of the query builder.
data.Content:
There seems to be a logic bug in the query designer with the NONE condition of the bracketed groups.
A query using ANY with a bracket as follows
The Bracket implies the selection of ANY
ItemC=3 AND (ItemA = 1 OR ItemA is null)
currently your system will do the following when you choose NONE
ItemC=3 AND (ItemA = 1 AND ItemA is null)
The above is the result of choosing none in the current software.  the problem is, this is forcing both items to be true when it should be checking to make sure none of the items are true...
for example, a fix would be to use AND NOT 
ItemC=3 AND NOT (ItemA = 1 OR ItemA is null)
this would correct the logic flaw in the software, currently NONE is saying if both items are true, using AND NOT would say as long as not 1 of these conditions are met
I will upload actual query output as well as my data model.

data.Title: EasyQuery JS getting started not working / example files
data.Content:
```
Dear Korzh-Team,
```
a few months ago I downloaded the example views for easyquery JS from your website.
I got there via the "getting started" site: https://korzh.com/easyquery/javascript/docs/getting-started.
Unfortunately this site is no longer available - and also the example files (php/js files) for the different views (advanced search, ad-hoc reporting, etc.) are untraceble.

data.Title: How to define columns for a query
data.Content:
Here's the situation:
I'm having trouble defining the columns to be included in the query that I'm sending from the Front-end to the Back-end. Keep in mind that I'm trying not to use any EasyQuery widgets in my UI.
Simply put for now, I want to generate a query like "SELECT MyColumn FROM MyTable". In the Front-end, I'm creating "var myView = new AdvancedSearchView()", and then passing the necessary options to make the object communicate with the Back-end. Up to there, everything seems fine (ie. the connexion is established, and the model is loaded in the Front-end). 
Later in the code, in order to launch the query, I'm calling "myView.executeQuery()", which sends a POST method with a "query" object. Inside that query, the "cols" property (ie. query.cols) is an empty array. Up to here, I can understand why it's empty, since I haven't defined any columns (ie. "MyTable.MyColumn").
Question: How can I manage to set this "cols" array to the desired columns? In the EasyQuery Demo I tried out a few months back, I saw that the when the "execute" POST call is made to the Back-end, this "query.cols" is defined as an Array containing the necessary columns to retreive.
I'm sorry if this question is either too detailed or not enough, and I'll certainly have a few more questions on this specific issue. Please let me know if I should send some additionnal information, or code snippets. Thanks!

data.Title: Loading Queries
data.Content:
Hi there, 
When loading queries from server utilizing the code provided in your examples there is an issue in the GetAllQueriesAsync function.
```
return Task.FromResult(ApplyUserGuard(_dbContext.AdhocReports)
                                .Where(qr => qr.ModelID == modelId)
                                .Select(qr => new QueryListItem(qr.ID.ToString(), qr.Name, qr.Description))
                                .AsEnumerable());
```
structured like this it will throw and error as Entities with Linq cannot process with constructors that require parameters.
The workaround I am using for now is:
```
return Task.FromResult(ApplyUserGuard(_dbContext.AdhocReports)
                                .Where(qr => qr.ModelID == modelId).ToList()
                                .Select(qr => new QueryListItem(qr.ID.ToString(), qr.Name, qr.Description))
                                .AsEnumerable());
```
the reason for this is there is no default constructor defined in the QueryListItem class, as normally it would be structured as:
```
return Task.FromResult(ApplyUserGuard(_dbContext.AdhocReports)
                                .Where(qr => qr.ModelID == modelId)
                                .Select(qr => new QueryListItem(){
                                           description = qr.Description,
                                            name = qr.Name,
                                            id = qr.ID.ToString()
                            }).AsEnumerable());
```
This way would work best as there would be no need for casting it to a list redundantly before creating the QueryListItem.
Can you look into this for me?

data.Title: Need to convert pre-existing available where clause in EasyQuery XML format
data.Content:
Hi,
We have pre-existing Where clause and we would like to load them in EasyQuery Panel, for that we would require to convert those expression first in XML format which EQPanel actually understand.
Is there any method of way available so that we can convert Where clause in EQPanel  understandable XML format.
For Ex: My where clause is
((First Name LIKE 'a%') AND   LastName LIKE 'b%')
and equivalent XML generated by EQPanel is :
<Query id="57eb5a64-3002-437f-9547-c425af5ba159" name="">
  <Description />
  <Columns>
    <Column caption="" sorting="None" sortIndex="-1">
      <Expr class="ENTATTR" id="TContactsSearchFormQuery" />
    </Column>
  </Columns>
  <JustSortedColumns />
  <Conditions linking="All">
    <Condition class="PDCT" enabled="True" readOnly="False" linking="Any">
      <Condition class="SMPL" enabled="True" readOnly="False">
        <Operator id="StartsWith" />
```
        <Expressions>
```
          <Expr class="ENTATTR" id="Contacts.FirstName" />
          <Expr class="CONST" type="String" kind="Scalar" value="a" text="a" />
```
        </Expressions>
```
      </Condition>
    </Condition>
    <Condition class="SMPL" enabled="True" readOnly="False">
      <Operator id="StartsWith" />
```
      <Expressions>
```
        <Expr class="ENTATTR" id="Contacts.LastName" />
        <Expr class="CONST" type="String" kind="Scalar" value="b" text="b" />
```
      </Expressions>
```
    </Condition>
  </Conditions>
</Query>
I want to generate same XML for my pre-existing available expressions.

data.Title: Derived Table
data.Content:
Hello.  Do you have any documentation on how to create a model to allow this:

```
select *
from (
    select
    sand.pattern [Pattern Number],
    [Last Activity] =   (
                            select max(hist.enterdate)
                            from cbhistry hist
                            inner join cb_log log on hist.CBNUMBER = log.CBNUMBER
                            where log.SANDMOLD = sand.pattern and hist.enterdate is not null
                        ),
    sand.PATTLOC1 [Location 1],
    sand.PATTLOC2 [Location 2],
    sand.PATTLOC3 [Location 3],
    sand.CASTSTYLE [Cast Style],
    sand.SIZE1 [Dimension 1],
    sand.size2 [Dimension 2],
    sand.size3 [Dimension 3],
    sand.size4 [Dimension 4],
    sand.size5 [Dimension 5],
    sand.NOTES [Notes]
    from psmast sand
     ) t1
where t1.[Last Activity] is not null and t1.[Last Activity] between '2019-01-01 00:00:00.000' and '2019-02-01 00:00:00.000'
order by t1.[Last Activity] desc
```

data.Title: Translations corrupted after re-linking project...?
data.Content:
I'm using RAD Studio 2010 and c++Builder, localizer 4.16.04
If I "Refresh Language Files", then "Synchronize DLLs" from Language manager and run my application, it works fine and localizations switch correctly. 
However, if I now simply re-link the project (or just "touch" any source file) , then when I rebuild and run the application, the non-native languages don't work correctly.   Some seem switched, and some are simply corrupted.
If I re-launch Language Manager the "Synchonize DLL" option isn't available, and I have to "Refresh Language Files" again, which is a very slow process (several minutes for me) with C++ as the entire project and all dependencies get rebuilt from scratch. I can now synchonize the DLLs again and it works, but my 10-second build turnaround has turned into many minutes :(
Surely this isn't right? I think I should only need to "Refresh Language Files" when the text to be translated changes for any reason (e.g. a new form is added)
Let me know if you'd like a screencast showing this or other debugging information.

Would it be possible to integrate this application into our ASP.NET core website and segregate the data users have access to?
For example, we have multiple organizations which are identified by an 'organization.id'. We would like to be able to restrict access to data where the rows have the same organization.id as the user. 
Thanks for your time. 
Please feel free to reach me by email at karan.bashyam@inforica.com
Best Regards, 
Karan

Chris Owens

data.Title: PROCEDURE 'sp_columns_managed' is not supported.
data.Content:
Is there anyway we could change the code for Data Model Editor to use sys.columns instead of sp_columns_managed.  sp_columns_managed is no longer supported.
I would be happy to take a shot at it if you the code is available. 
Azure Synapse AKA Sql On Demand  
Some versions of SQL Server don't allow (stored)Procedures any more.
We are working with MS on a POC for their new SQL Product Synapse and were interested in seeing how your product could be used as a simple front end.
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/synapse-analytics/
Let me know if there is a better work around

data.Title: Additional server side processing of queried data
data.Content:
My name is Aaron Goodman I work with LexisNexis and we have an enterprise license.
I'm having trouble accomplishing what I believe should be an extremely standard usage of these search components, but I'm running into an issue and I'd appreciate some assistance.
We are using ASP.NET core and EF Core for data access.
I've built our model using the DataModelEditor and have the basics working. We however ONLY want to use the query panel from you and everything else we want to handle ourselves.
I'm using javascript code to fetch the query, build my output columns and ultimately call executeQuery.
I'm then manually processing the data returned from the (view.context.resultSet).
However, I would like to simply send the query to my controller and execute the built query (from the client UI) and handle all data manipulation on the server side. I cannot seem to locate the proper classes or Nuget libraries and certainly no documentation that explains this.
Quite simply I would like to have a method in my controller which takes the modelId and the queryId, both of which I can get via javascript and I'd like to pass that along to the server and process the query and all results on the server. I would then return/manipulate the data as I see fit.
Is this possible?
Thanks,
```
Aaron

data.Title: Problem deploying to IIS
data.Content:
I have a web application based on your EqAspNet4Demo solution.  Everything works fine running in Visual Studio 2019, and using IIS Express.
When I publish the files to IIS on my Windows 10 machine, the initial home page loads successfully but when I click to load the page with the actual advanced search UI, I get an error attempting to load the model.
From what I can see, it looks like it cannot find the /api/easyquery/models end point to load the model named 'Merlin', although it works fine using VS and IIS Express.
The AdvancedSearchController is as follows.
    [RoutePrefix("api/easyquery")]
```
    public class AdvancedSearchController : EasyQueryApiController
```
The error I get is as follows.
```
Warning!

The following unexpected error has occured. Please contact your System Administrator for assistance. Can't load model [Merlin]
Detailed Error Information:
Module	   IIS Web Core

data.Title: EasyQuery.js v6: Custom Value Editors
data.Content:
Hi,
I am integrating EasyQuery.js v6.0.10 for a customer who uses EasyQuery v5.3.4.5 for ASP.NET.
We have a use-case where we want to display a custom-made form to allow users to select values
instead of using the default input fields (in the conditions panel).
According to the ["Introduction to value editors"](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/fundamentals/about-data-editors)
this should be possible using a value editor of the type "Custom" and handling the event "CustomValue".
However I could not find any documentation on where I must register this event listener nor does the
introduction page provide an example.
I even looked through the source code of EasyQuery.js and did not find any location where a CustomValue event is fired.
I also found this [how-to](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/how-to/custom-value-editor) describing how custom value editors can be processed, but that uses jQuery which version 6 of EasyQuery.js dropped (and we want to avoid).
I hope you can point me to some resources describing how we can achieve the desired behavior.
Thank you very much and best regards,
Mohammed Chelouti

data.Content:
```
/*Korzh.EasyQuery.Db.SqlStatement
```
I have a SQL Server table with about 20 million rows and I noticed the SQL Statement generated 
was reading 100s of times more pages than it needed to.
Queries are below
--Page reads 21843 vs 6118164 280x importment 
--Exec Time 162ms vs 16,855 ms  
I was planning on changing the select clause and final sql statement in the 
Korzh.EasyQuery.Db.SqlStatement class to see if the improvements break anything else.
I just wanted to check 1st to see if I'm missing anything like a special statement generator.
Thanks
Brian
*/
```
SELECT Party.DMCID AS DMCID, COUNT(*) OVER() as T0TA1R3C 
FROM dbo.DMCID_PARTY AS Party
WHERE DMCID > 10000
```
ORDER BY 1 OFFSET 100000 ROWS FETCH NEXT 30 ROWS ONLY;
```
--(30 rows affected)
--Table 'Worktable'. Scan count 3, logical reads 6081572, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
--Table 'DMCID_PARTY'. Scan count 1, logical reads 36592, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
```
-- SQL Server Execution Times:
```
--   CPU time = 13594 ms,  elapsed time = 16855 ms.
```
WITH OrgQueryWithOutPaging AS (
```
	SELECT Party.DMCID AS DMCID
	FROM dbo.DMCID_PARTY AS Party
	WHERE DMCID > 10000
)
, TotalRowCount AS (
	SELECT COUNT(*) T0TA1R3C FROM OrgQueryWithOutPaging
)
, OrgQueryWithPaging AS (
	SELECT * FROM OrgQueryWithOutPaging 
```
	ORDER BY 1 OFFSET 100000 ROWS FETCH NEXT 30 ROWS ONLY
```
)
SELECT * FROM OrgQueryWithPaging CROSS JOIN TotalRowCount;
--(30 rows affected)

data.Title: How to add custom hints to the SQL statements generated by Easy Query
data.Content:
Hello again,
We are looking for a way to add some hinting to the SQL statements generated by Easy Query in order to increase performance.
Specifically we would like to add the 'NOLOCK' hint in order to avoid locking during query execution.
So if Easy Query generates the following
```
select * from table_XYZ where ABC='some value'
```
We would like it to be 
```
select * from table_XYZ with(NOLOCK) where ABC='some value'
```
How would you recommend we approach this?
Thanks
```
Mike

data.Title: Problem with filter field<>value
data.Content:
We have had some concern over the results for a report with a filter in the format "<field> not equal to <value>". Seems that a SQL query with field<>'value' does not include nulls, however, for most purposes, the null entries should be included as they do not equal the specified value either. For illustration: we have a query:
```
select * from table1 where field<>'value'
```
We would like it to be 
```
select * from table1 where (field <>'value or field is null)

data.Title: Solution for my Application architecture
data.Content:
My application is a 3-tier SOA architecture (Web Server, Application Server, DB server (SQL Server)). The web / presentation layer doesn't have access to the database directly to get the Data Model. So I wrote a WCF Data Service on my application layer and getting the DB Context to the Web layer. So now I have access to the DB Context and your tool can use it to get the database objects and their relationships. That solves the first step in using your tool.
I have an issue with fetching data with WCF Data Service. It doesn't support joins between tables. That defeats the whole purpose of having a query builder. We need ways to work around it. One thought is to get your tool to spit out the SQL query from whatever the user does, send it back to my application layer, send it to sql server to be run as a dynamic query, get the result set (may be a data table), pass the data back to your tool to show in a grid, charts, etc. Is this possible?
Thanks,
Sanjay

data.Title: ASP.NET Web Api vs Node.js
data.Content:
I'm Tableau Trainer at [Tableau Training institute in Chennai](https://intellipaat.com/tableau-training-chennai/) & have quite recently started to connect a web platform that I work on to other quite complex systems mostly written in C#. Most of my experience is in web development in PHP and JavaScript And I also have some experience in writing web services in WCF.
Sadly I had experienced many difficulties in writing WCF services for my PHP web platform, slow development, very (very) complicated configurations in-order to respond well in JSON and to work RESTful and more.
Naturally, I started looking around at other technologies, one, in particular, caught my eye Node.js which might be perfect for me because I have quite a lot of experience in JavaScript and that way I won't need my windows server anymore. My other option is, of course, to keep writing services in C# but switch to ASP.NET Web API instead. The switch will probably be much easier than from WCF to Node.js.
Any thoughts or suggestions on the matter? Does anyone have experience in writing web services in Node.js and can point me in the direction of a good tutorial? or am I way off and I shouldn't be using Node.js for web services at all?

data.Title: Speedup the Import of translations in language manager
data.Content:
Hello Team,
We are using Localizer version 4.16 with Delphi Rio. The translations are sent as text files by the Translators. They are not using the Localizer tool to do the translations. So, we will have to import these translations into Localizer.
First, we are generating the language files with Language Manager command line tool and then import the translation text files (Unicode format) into the respective Language file in Localizer.
We have multiple modules and each module has 44 Languages and 23 Brands. On top, we have to do this import many times in a day as we have configured the above in Git build.
We noticed that the import of translations is taking more time. 
Please find the statistics :-
Create Language files (44 languages)                                       4 seconds
Import of all the text files for all brands for 1 module             100 seconds
(each import file contains approximately 2400 lines)
The complete import cycle takes 15 minutes
This means, to test a feature branch, if we initiate a build, language generation alone takes 15 minutes.
Is there a way to speed up the import of the translations in to language files ?
Thank you in advance anticipating your reply.
Best regards,
Sree

data.Title: Query sync throwing an exception
Query building issue
data.Content:
I am trying to create one query where 
I want if i set  FirstName like 'A%' then query should be
```
Select Contacts.* from Contacts
INNER JOIN SecurityILSKey ON SecurityILSKey.ILSKey = Contacts.ILSKEY
Where FirstName like 'A%'
```
but it is generating
```
Select Contacts.* from Contacts
Where FirstName like 'A%'
```
If i set EventID like 'A%'
Then Query should be
```
Select Contacts.* from Contacts
INNER JOIN SecurityILSKey ON SecurityILSKey.ILSKey = Contacts.ILSKEY
Inner Join EVENTSCONTACTS.CONTACTS = CONTACTS.CONTACTS 
Inner Join EVENTS EVENTS.EVENTS = EVENTSCONTACTS.EVENTS
Where EventID like 'A%'
```
But it is generating
```
Select Contacts.* from Events
Where EventID like 'A%'
```
I am also adding link which is not appearing 
```
		    var mappingTable = (dataModel as DbModel).Tables.FindByName("Contacts");
                    tableSecurityILSKey = (DbTable)(dataModel as DbModel).Tables.FindByName("SecurityILSKey");

data.Title: You should read some modern password guidance
data.Content:
I have just spent a bunch of time trying to create a new log on to see the "live demo" of easy.report. It has rejected my password numerous times.
1. If you are going to impose random password criteria (aka "security theatre") -- especially for a simple demo -- you should list those criteria all at once so that I don't have to keep trying three or four or more times. First it wanted a special character. So I gave it one. Then it wants a number instead (or maybe as well, I don't know). And so on.
2. You might want to look at current guidance from the likes of Troy Hunt, Microsoft and NIST -- who all agree that requiring random "special characters" is not recommended. 
https://info.microsoft.com/MicrosoftPasswordGuidance.html
https://www.intellisuite.com/blog/2019-password-policy-best-practices
https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/
Best Regards.

data.Title: Installing our application that has SimpleQuery on another computer
data.Content:
After installing SimpleQuery and rebuilding our application on our development workstations, our application ran fine and SimpleQuery worked great! However, when we installed our application on another computer and attempted to run the application, the application reported that it could not find three SimpleQuery files. We copied the missing files from SimpleQuery to the directory that the application ran from and then the application did not show these errors any longer. The application could then find these files. They were:
```
ado_sq25.bpl from c:\KLIB\sq\lib
sq25.bpl from c:\Windows\SysWOW64
```
KProcs25.bpl from c:\KLIB\kprocs\25x64
However, a new application error message appeared which stated:
"The application was unable to start correctly (0xc000007b). Click OK to close the application."
Please understand that our application would run just fine prior to installing the updated Korzh SimpleQuery. 
We understand this error message to mean that there is a compatibility problem. Do you have any insight? Are we still missing something with our installation? Could this be that SimpleQuery is a 64-bit version and our application is a 32-bit? If this was true, then I would not expect it to run on our development workstations.
Please help us with this problem.

data.Title: Easy Query Features
data.Content:
Hi Team,
              We have a requirement where we need to give end users an option to create queries in our application. We have a web application built using angular at client side and have a .Net core server back end hosted separately. We have few queries to be addressed before buying the paid edition.
1. In the sample application provided for .Net core with angular, the angular SPA application is bundled inside the .Net core and hence all the requests are handled from the same domain. In our case, since both are hosted at different places we need to make a cross domain request from angular application to our backend services. Is it possible to do this with Easy query?
For instance, on page load 'http://localhost:17184/.easyquery/lck' this request goes to the same domain where we have hosted our angular application and we need to override this to point to our our backend. Can we also add other headers to the same request for our backend authentication? 
      Any code snippets would be helpful for us to do an initial POC.
2. We need to clear the query used on every page load as multiple users will be using our application. Please explain this is possible.
3. We have a requirement to save the created queries in the form of SQL itself. Is it possible to do it in the .Net core server end.
Expecting your replies at earliest.
Thanks,
```
Dinesh.R

If I then create a query with english model and add in list condition using some values from the list above, it is being saved as:
{"tag":1,"op":"InList","exprs":[{"tag":2,"dtype":1,"kind":2,"val":"D_InventoryItem.Type"},{"tag":1,"dtype":1,"kind":4,"val":"0,1","txt":"Tree,Tree group"}]}
When I open the query then with german model all is OK except the in list condition label - I see "Tree,Tree group" in there, expected is "Baum,Baumgruppe". Seems that it reads the text from query txt parameter, instead of reading it from model. Is there a way how to update this label to model editor values and ignore what is in txt attribute?
Thanks

data.Title: Error loading model
data.Content:
Hi,
I’m currently trying to set up EasyQuery in our application to evaluate whether it will be suitable for our needs. What I’m basically trying to achieve at first is to recreate something like this: https://korzh.com/demo/easyquery-asp-net-core-razor/data-filtering 
In our case however, the front-end is not in MVC Razor but Stencil.js (similar to React, but compiling to vanilla web components from JSX). We are using EF Core with Npgsql/postgres 
I set up my Startup.cs to match this: https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/getting-started/aspnet-core-razor 
I then installed the npm modules to our stencil SPA and translated as best I could the script and markup from that example page into my stencil component, it appears to execute as expected as far as I could twll.
When viewing the component however, I get an error. The client code is calling /api/easyquery/models/__default and that is returning a status 400 with the error:
```
LoadModel: Can't load model __default.
```
An item with the same key has already been added. Key: AbpFeatures
AbpFeatures is one of our tables. Unfortunately though no stack trace is written on the server so I can’t really tell what’s going on. I took a look back in at your ASP.NET Core sample project that contains the example page I’m trying to recreate, and noticed extra lines in Startup.cs there compared to the getting started guide.
So I added two extra lines to mine:
```
            services.AddEasyQuery()
                .UseSqlManager()
                .AddDefaultExporters()
                .RegisterDbGate<NpgSqlGate>();
```
I still however encounter the same problem. In Configure I’m just doing:
```
app.UseEasyQuery(options => {
                options.Endpoint = "/api/easyquery";
                options.UseDbContext<OurDbContext>();
            });
```
Do you know what might be causing the problem I’m facing? I’d be greatly appreciative of any help you can offer.
Thanks and best regards,
Oliver McNally

data.Title: How to handle compound keys from different tables
data.Content:
How to handle compound keys from different tables?
I will attached sample files of data model and query for your reference.
I would like to get the following result, any suggestion?
```
SELECT CustomerPref.CustomerID AS CustomerPref_CustomerID, Customers.CompanyName AS Customers_CompanyName, Orders.OrderID AS Orders_OrderID, Orders.OrderDate AS Orders_OrderDate, Products.ProductID AS Products_ProductID, ProductLang.Description AS ProductLang_Description, Order_Details.UnitPrice AS Order_Details_UnitPrice, Order_Details.Discount AS Order_Details_Discount, Order_Details.Quantity AS Order_Details_Quantity, Products.QuantityPerUnit AS Products_QuantityPerUnit 
FROM (((((dbo.Order_Details AS Order_Details
     INNER JOIN dbo.Orders AS Orders ON (Order_Details.OrderID  = Orders.OrderID ))
     INNER JOIN dbo.Customers AS Customers ON (Orders.CustomerID  = Customers.CustomerID ))
     INNER JOIN dbo.CustomerPref AS CustomerPref ON (CustomerPref.CustomerID  = Customers.CustomerID ))
     INNER JOIN dbo.Products AS Products ON (Order_Details.ProductID  = Products.ProductID ))
     INNER JOIN dbo.ProductLang AS ProductLang ON (ProductLang.ProductId  = Products.ProductID and ProductLang.LangId  = CustomerPref.PreferLangId ))

data.Title: Parsing Data into Vuetify Data Table
data.Content:
Hello,

My client app is a Vue.js application and I am trying display my query results in a Vuetify Data Table in this format: 
```
<v-data-table
    :headers="headers"
    :items="list"
    :items-per-page="10"
    class="outlined elevation-0"
    sortable="true"
> </v-data-table>
```
I'm using a PostgreSQL database and my queries return results but I am not sure the best way to access the results in order to parse them into a list that will go into this table. I have the headers of this v-data-table working but I am having trouble accessing the results data to display with the "list" variable. I tried using: 
``` this.view.getContext().resultContent ``` 
For some reason this string property keeps returning null or nothing when I try to display it in the results section after executing. The old results grid still shows the data so I know that it is returning data. Do you know if there is a way I could access the results after running a query and then parse the results so I could display it in the vuetify data table? Is there a better way to do this? 

Let me know if this is not explained clearly. Thanks.

data.Title: Response caching (Browser)

I would love to be able to add an additional QueryString (VaryByQueryKeys) to the url of the GetModel action. Is it possible to add options via the JavaScript API during the GetModel? Do you intend to support caching browser in the future?

data.Content:
First statement of the function may cause System.NullReferenceException.  
```
        internal bool AddJoinToAppropriateResultTable(ResultTableNode resultNode, Table table, string condExpr)
        {
            var linkToParent = resultNode.LinkToParent.TableLink; <-- THIS statement may cause System.NullReferenceException
```
Suggestion:
```
var linkToParent = resultNode.LinkToParent?.TableLink; 
```
Could you please fix and notify me after update version release?

data.Title: Missing JsonReader.Read(); in Korzh.EasyQuery.Services.EasyQueryManagerSql.GetQueryBuilderCore function
data.Content:
Missing the first Read() call after Json Reader created: 
```
protected override IQueryBuilder GetQueryBuilderCore(Query query, JObject options)
{
```
:
:
```
                var formats = options["formats"];
                if (formats != null) {
                    builder.Formats.ReadFromJsonAsync(formats.CreateReader()).Wait(); <-- BUG HERE
                }
```
:
:
```
}
```
Suggestion:
```
protected override IQueryBuilder GetQueryBuilderCore(Query query, JObject options)
{
```
:
:
```
                var formats = options["formats"];
                if (formats != null) {
                    var formatReader = formats.CreateReader(); //<-- NEW added
                    formatReader.Read(); //<-- NEW added
                    builder.Formats.ReadFromJsonAsync(formatReader).Wait(); // changed from builder.Formats.ReadFromJsonAsync(formats.CreateReader()).Wait(); 
                }
```
:
:
```
}

data.Title: Data model reinitialization
data.Content:
Hello,
 we consider using your EasyQuery solution in our project. 
I have few questions. I would like to know if it's possible to do reinitialization of DbModel during runtime in case we would load the model from DB connection. Example: We an entity Employee with some static fields (Firstname, Lastname, Email, etc.) and some dynamic fields in another related table where users can define their own attributes. It means we add or remove columns during runtime and we would need to reload DbModel after this action. I just want to know if it's possible and if it has an influence on performance (the model will include up to 10 database tables).
Our application is multitenant. Every instance of the application (using one web service) has a separate database that can have a different database schema. I read the documentation and I think that using a custom EasyQueryManagerSql could be a solution for this issue. Will it work or there are other best practices for this?
Final question. If we buy a license (team or company) for ASP.NET, could we use also other libraries for ASP.NET CORE or WinForms? Or we would have to buy a single license for every technology?
Thank you for your answers
Best regards,
Tomas Mudra

data.Title: Table Categories
data.Content:
Hi there,
We have been using Easy Query for several months now. We have a core model which will suit all of our customers, but we want to add industry specific tables for different types of customer. For example if I have Customer A and Customer B. A is in retail and B is in manufacturing. In our model, we have say 10 entities that are common across A & B. But we also have an entity called 'Retail' and another called 'Manufacturing'. I want Customer A to see the core entities + Retail and Customer B to see core entities + Manufacturing.
I know I could simply create two different models and load the correct model at runtime, but I want to avoid having to maintain the core entities across multiple different models.
I saw the Category option on the tables screen in DME and I wondered if we could use this to hide or show specific entities according their category so the end user only sees the core entities plus whatever category they belong to?
Is that something we could do? If not, is there another way we could do this?

data.Title: Problem with Oracle 11g
data.Content:
Hi,

For a project I am implementing I will need a mechanism to be able to build/change queries for reports, save and load them and export results. So, after a search I did, I found EasyQuery Advanced search that fully meets my needs.

Before I buy it, I decided to use your trial to test it and I made the necessary changes to a new project based on your demos from [here](https://github.com/easyquery/Net4Samples) and from your [documentation](https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/getting-started).  

In my project I use the following
- C# .NET Framework 4.6.1
- ASP.NET MVC / Razor 
- DB Oracle 11g (I use nuget Oracle.ManagedDataAccess driver for Oracle Database)

Everything works properly with MSSQL server but I have issues with Oracle DB!  I have trying all available ways from [here] (https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/getting-started/working-with-data-model) to build the data model. Entities, columns and conditions... everything in UI seems to work properly with all different data models I have tried, but I face an error when I execute the query.

Also I have changed the SQL Formats to Oracle `<options.UseSqlFormats(Korzh.EasyQuery.Db.FormatType.Oracle)>`.

I have noticed that the error I receive is related to the SQL syntax statement. The working SQL Oracle query is the following: 
```sh
SELECT Country."Id" AS Id, Country."Name" AS Name FROM "Country" Country
```

But in all cases / configurations I have try the generated sql statement It is always wrong!

### Case A: model loading from DbConnection
Generated SQL query:
```sh
SELECT Country.Id AS Id, Country.Name AS Name FROM Country Country
```

### Case B: model loading from TestDBModel.xml (I have trying several options from DME application)
Generated SQL query: 
```sh
SELECT "Country"."Id" AS Id, "Country"."Name" AS Name FROM "Country" "Country"
```

### Case C: model loading from DbContext
Generated SQL query: 
```sh
SELECT Country."Name" AS Name FROM TESTDB_USER.Country Country
```

## `The Problem`
When I press button "Execute" I receive an error from endpoint
```sh
https://localhost:44304/api/easyquery/models/__default/queries/testQuery/execute
{"result":"error","message":"ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended"}
```
> Note that the error message it’s different for each case but it is depending on SQL query syntax.

For my tests above I use the following nugets depending on each case
- Korzh.EasyQuery version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet4 version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.DataExport version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.Db version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.EntityFramework6 version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.Linq version="5.4.7"
- Korzh.EasyQuery.OdpCoreGate version="5.4.7"
- Oracle.ManagedDataAccess version="18.3.0"
- Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.EntityFramework version="18.3.0"


## Questions 
1.	I have use for my tests your demo license keys `<Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.License.Key = "ZNQbiled5JoJMwzArFmSSQDSU0J8UX";>` and  `<Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.JSLicense.Key = "voC5XVNcovrofRwXkHNKEABNJ4VH40";>` and I believe that it works with Oracle DB or there is any limitations? 
2.	Do you have a working Oracle example?
3.	Could you provide me how to configure the correct Oracle sql formats for dynamic generated sql statement?

Please try to response as soon as possible because if finally EasyQuery works with Oracle 11g Ι have to purchase the licence and add the implementation to my project until 19/03/2021.

Thanks, in advanced

data.Title: How to add where clause for all queries?

We use the following documentation - https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/how-to/add-extra-condition to add a an extra query condition for all queries.
When there is a query which does not contain the table where from is an extra condition, there is an exception "object reference not set".
The scenario is:
- there are many reports based on different tables
- we need to add an extra condition for queries, but the condition should be execute if the table is part of the whole query. 
- all queries should work without that extra condition of there is no table which is part of that condition

- Do you have a version that are updated more often than the others (JS vs Angular vs VueJS)
- What are the differences between the Native (web) vs the VueJS application.
- Is the interface responsive / mobile friendly? We saw in the demo that it did not seem to work.
We use VueJS in our company but we don't want to slow down or slow down the frequency of updates because we have selected this version.
In short, we want to find a way to save as much time as possible and we don't want to have to invest a lot of time in the interface. 
FYI: I'm a really old customer and before i was always talk with Sergiy.
Best Regards
Martin Duperron

data.Title: Changing Title in Columns Widget
data.Content: Hi, I am using Vue.js for my ClientApp and I am trying to change the default title name in the Columns Widget. Sometimes the attributes from different entities have the same attribute name such as "type", and I would like to have it so that if the user chooses attributes from different entities but with the same name, the title defaults to "{entity}_{attr}" instead of just "{attr}". For instance, if the user chooses the attribute "type" from the "asset" entity and "type" from the "group" entity, then in the Columns widget (and again in the results table) the title for these columns will be "asset_type" and "group_type". If an attribute's name is unique in the chosen column list, then that attribute's column title will default to just the attribute name instead of including the entity. Do you know if there is a way for me to do that? I tried testing out changing the titleElementFormat in viewOptions for the EqContext, but it did not change. I'm not sure if I can change that to default differently for the two different cases anyway (duplicate attribute names vs unique). Let me know if there's a way I could do this. I would like the title name in the column widget to reflect what is also in the results table of course and visa versa. Thanks.

data.Title: "Add Conditions" button causes crash
data.Content:
When we use the "Add Conditions" button on the Entities Panel, the conditions do not show up in the Query Panel (Conditions panel). If we subsequently try to add a condition in the Query Panel, it crashes the entire program. See stack trace below.
The added conditions do appear in the SQL text when we run the SqlQueryBuilder, so I know the new conditions are getting added. They are just not appearing correctly.
This same behavior happens with the DotNetSamples for WinForms. It happened for EqDemoWinFormsNet4, EqDemoWinFormsNet4VB and EqDemoWinFormsNet5.
Is there some code I need to add to get the Query Panel to redraw correctly to show the newly added conditions?
```

Hi,
I stumbled on the nodejs sample here https://github.com/easyquery/OtherSamples/tree/master/eqs/NodeJS
And have been attempting to adapt it to my model. I used the Data Model Editor 7 tool to generate a model from my local database, but the resulting XML had version '15' and the sqlquerybuilder.com upload form said the max supported version is 14, but I didn't see a version selection option during export.
Secondly I'm wondering if sqlquerybuilder.com just runs regular easyquery source code that would be included in my license?
Thanks

I want it to be like -
```
select * from department dep where dep.isDeleted=false
```
I don't want to add these conditions manually. Just configured with code which helps in joins from multiple tables. Thanks

data.Title: Problem with endpoint "api/easyquery/models/[ModelName]"
data.Content:
Hi,

Recently I upgrade Easyquery nugets to the latest stable version 7.0.6 and when I deploy my web app to the production environment I face the following error. 

```XML
<Error>
<Message>An error has occurred.</Message>
<ExceptionMessage>Method 'ExecuteAsync' in type 'Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.EqOkHttpActionResult' from assembly 'Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet4, Version=7.0.6.2, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' does not have an implementation.</ExceptionMessage>
<ExceptionType>System.TypeLoadException</ExceptionType>
<StackTrace> at Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.EasyQueryApiController.<GetModelAsync>d__2.MoveNext() at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncTaskMethodBuilder`1.Start[TStateMachine](TStateMachine& stateMachine) at Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.EasyQueryApiController.GetModelAsync(String modelId) at lambda_method(Closure , Object , Object[] ) at System.Web.Http.Controllers.ReflectedHttpActionDescriptor.ActionExecutor.<>c__DisplayClass6_3.<GetExecutor>b__2(Object instance, Object[] methodParameters) at System.Web.Http.Controllers.ReflectedHttpActionDescriptor.ExecuteAsync(HttpControllerContext controllerContext, IDictionary`2 arguments, CancellationToken cancellationToken) --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown --- at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw() at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task) at System.Web.Http.Controllers.ApiControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeActionAsyncCore>d__1.MoveNext() --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown --- at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw() at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task) at System.Web.Http.Controllers.ActionFilterResult.<ExecuteAsync>d__5.MoveNext() --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown --- at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw() at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task) at System.Web.Http.Dispatcher.HttpControllerDispatcher.<SendAsync>d__15.MoveNext()</StackTrace>
</Error>
```

In your example, I see that the same endpoint [https://korzh.com/demo/easyquery-asp-net-core-razor/api/easyquery/models/NWindSQL](https://korzh.com/demo/easyquery-asp-net-core-razor/api/easyquery/models/NWindSQL) return the JSON model.

**Note**: Ajax call is not working on the production website but works fine in localhost. I cannot able to debug this issue.

Thanks in advance

data.Title: Filtering list of saved queries
data.Content:
Hello,
I want to be able to filter the list of saved queries that is in the "Load" dropdown to only be queries that the user created themselves. Is there a way to pass another parameter to the GetAllQueriesAsync method in my IQueryStore or maybe is there a way for me to filter them on the front end (Vue.js) before they are displayed in the dropdown? I'd like it so that the user can only view and edit queries that they created and so I want to pass the user ID to the backend so that I can filter out the queries by user ID, but I am not doing authentication the normal way so I cannot access the user ID with an HttpContextAccessor. Let me know if you have any suggestions for how I could do this. 
Thanks.

data.Title: Null Exception from WriteExportedDataAsync
data.Content:
Per our previous request for information about the API, we received guidance to “create a descendant of EasyQueryApiHandler and override its HandleExportResultAsync method to make it load the query before calling WriteExportedDataAsync procedure." 
I was able to get the override to be called from my code, which is very helpful, but whenever I try to call the WriteExportedDataAsync Procedure, I’m getting a null execption, do I have something mis-configured? Could you tell me more about what the function is expecting, so I can send it what it needs properly?

data.Title: 404 error api/reports/lck
I have messed up my localization and need your help
data.Content:
I have been using your localizer for many years (version 4.7.0.54) now with no issues.  I know the problem I am presenting to you is NOT a problem with your product and frankly, I am embarrassed to even ask for support after so many years, but I am at a loss.  If I need to purchase the most recent update, I will gladly do so.
It seems that something has happened recently which causes any resource string in my ResStrings.pas unit (Delphi 2007) are linked incorrectly after I make a switch to a different language.  This has only recently begun to happen. Button captions in my forms are translated correctly, only items referenced in the resource strings unit are causing the issue.  This causes an unhandled exception with SysUtils.Format function where an incorrect string is returned and there is no formatting characters in the string being "fetched" as the resource string.  I hope that isn't confusing.
Have you ever seen an issue like this and how can I go about resolving it?  If you need some additional information from me or if you need me to purchase the latest version in order to get support please let me know.
John Taylor
Snappy Fax Software

data.Title: Best practices for SQL injection prevention
data.Content:

I started working on a project recently that's been using this library for around 3+ years.
The project recently went through a security audit where it was discovered that the `EqDbMvcController.ExecuteQuery` endpoint we depend on is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.
Is there any content/advice on best practices in this library to protect against this?
Version: 3.4.0.112
Regards,
```
Cameron

data.Title: exceptions
Proof of concept issues
data.Content:
Hi,
We are currently developing a reporting proof of concept for a client and have been asked to look into using EasyQuery as one of the potential tools for the final product.
We are using the .NET Core version of EasyQuery with Angular. 
Our issue is largely around authentication. Users are autenticated with Azure AD and we are using the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.JwtBearer library and JwtBearerEvents. 
We have been able to pass the bearer token in the requests easyquery makes to the server, with the following code:
```
    `this.view = new AdvancedSearchView();
    `this.context = this.view.getContext();
    `        
    `let services = this.context.getServices();
    `let httpClient = services.getHttpClient();
    `httpClient.defaultHeaders.authentication = 'Bearer ' + token;
```
However it seems that requests to the EasyQuery endpoint do not go through the authentication process and so we never have a Principal and are unable to get the user account for the Principal and then set necessary filtering for that user.
Would you be able to advise and point us to or provide an example. We've noticed that some of the examples in the documentation are possibly out of date as they differ from what is available in the current version. 
Many Thanks in advance for your assistance in this matter.
Best wishes,
Paul

data.Title: NGO License
data.Content:
Hi,

REEDiSA (Rural Economic and Enterprise Development in Southern Africa) is an HGO based in Pretoria that helps with the economic enablement of persons living in rural areas of Southern Africa. As I am just a developer I would like to point you to our website (https://reedisa.co.za) for more detailed information about our work.
I am busy developing a system in .NET Code MVC where our clients can manage their activity (currently mainly farmers) and the various sponsors can trach the results of ther sponsorship efforts. The folks at ASPNet Zero have graciously sponsored us with a copy of their product and that is what I am developing the system with. 
I found your product on the wen and it would fill a much needed hole in the reporting area. 
I would really appreciate it if we could use your product free of charge as we do not have a lot of funds available for the development.
Obviously your name would appear, along with our other sponsors, on the website.
Thank you in advance and I hope that this could be the start of a long relationship with you
Peace to you all, 
Chris Krause (Developer)

data.Title: MSI Reproductive Choices: [ASP.Net Core and WPF options]
data.Content:
We are a software reseller based in Devon UK and we have a customer interested in a quote for MSI Reproductive Choices: [ASP.Net Core and WPF options] 5x developer licenses [Perpetual and Subscription versions.] , please can you advise if you work with resellers? If so, please can you provide the following information:
-	A formal quotation or pricing via e-mail, including list pricing and any discounts you offer
-	Details on how long the pricing is valid for
-	Any territory restrictions 
-	Your stock rotation policy (number of days)
-	Can you provide a link from your website to your modern slavery policy
-	Can you advise if there is an auto renewal of any subscriptions and provide cancellation notice details. 
Please can you also provide the below information so that we can set you up as a supplier on our system ready to quote the customer.
-	Contact name and e-mail address
```
-	Postal address
```
-	Purchase currency
-	Payment terms
-	Payment method
With the introduction of the EU General Data Protection Regulations ('GDPR') we will be unable to send Personal Data to suppliers such as yourselves without a signed GDPR data processing agreement, and evidence of you having appropriate safeguards in place to protect that data. data.Title: Exception "ELUInvalidResLibrary"
data.Content:
NOTE: It would be helpful, if I could send you some screenshots (in one zip-file).
```
====================================================================
Title:		Localizer Exception "ELUInvalidResLibrary"
Project: 	--
Author:	    Detlef Stern
Date: 		02-Jun-2021
====================================================================
```
I'm trying to localize an Embacardero-XE5-Project (C++) with FastReports.
Main problem: After starting the programme, the Exception ""ELUInvalidResLibrary"
              raises (refer "Localizer19_Exc.png").
Localizer Version(s) 4.x Standard and Pro (refer X_LngMngVersion.png").
NOTE: On my PC KLIB is installed to "C:\KLIB..."
I used the Localizer-Std before without any Problems. Problems started, when I
linked "LocFRProcs.pas".
I tried a lot of combinations to figure out, how to solve the problem.
The main differences are "linking LocFRProcs.pas", "linking LocUtils.pas"
and using Standard or Pro Version. There a some Screenshots showing the project
for Localizer Standard and Pro (Std_*.png and Pro_*.png).
The following table will show what happens with different combinations.
```
         Link            Link             
         LocUtils.pas |  LocFRProcs.pas | Result
-----------------------------------------------        
```
LocStd | Yes          |  No             | All O.K.
LocStd | Yes          |  Yes            | EXCEPTION
LocStd | No           |  No             | EXCEPTION (???!)
LocPro | No           |  don't care     | EXCEPTION
```
LocStd = Localizer Standard
LocPro = Localizer Pro
Link   = "Add to Project"
```
Each combination has been build without error or warning.
There are some screenshots to show what I did, used and what happens.
```
====================================================================
```
Some additional informations of problems I had. When I linked "LocFRProcs.pas"
the first time, al lot of Pascal-files from FastReport has to be translated, or
fs_*.hpp files has to be created or updated for some reason I don't know
(and don't want to know). Refer "X_FastReports.png".
The FastReport stuff is installed to "ProgrammeX86" dirctory, which is write
protected. To get rid of all that resulting errors, I had to enable "write"
(Windows security settings) for the FastReport-directory.
I still get a lot of hints, when linking "LocFRProcs.pas" 
(refer X_PascalShit_2.png").
For the call " TranslateReportObj()" "LocFRProcs.hpp" has to be included.
This file doesn't exsist, after installing KLIB. It will be created with the
first compilation of "LocFRProcs.pas". It's a bit confusing.
Starting with the Localizer-Standard, I'm working on this for a week now.
I stumbled from error to error, to error, to error, to error, ...
To be honest, I'm a bit tired now and don't have any idea what to do next.
Thanks for help in advance 
```
Detlef Stern
```
P.S:
Don't get me wrong. I'm using Localizer since Version 2.x with BCB4 and
I love your product.

data.Title: Easily convert Sql to Eq compatible Json
data.Content:
Hi,
I want to keep generated query in the database as a json string, so then later i can dynamically generate reports,
Is there any mechanism or tool to do this easily, if so it is very helpful
As a example i want to keep below sql query in my database to generate reports.
```
SELECT wl.RequestByName,
 MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 1 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T1',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 2 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T2',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 3 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T3',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 4 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T4',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 5 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T5',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 6 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T6',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 7 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T7',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 8 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T8',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 9 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T9',
   MAX(CASE WHEN Priority = 10 THEN wl.PermitName  ELSE '' END) AS 'T10'
FROM 
(SELECT CONCAT(u.FirstName,' ', u.LastName) AS RequestByName, u.Email, cftv.[Value] as HireDate, p.[Name] AS PermitName, pp.[Priority]  FROM [Security].[User] u
INNER JOIN [Policy].[UserType] ut ON u.UserTypeId = ut.Id
INNER JOIN [DynamicControl].[ControlFieldTemplateValue] cftv ON u.Id = cftv.UserId
INNER JOIN [DynamicControl].[ControlField] cf ON cftv.ControlFieldId = cf.Id
INNER JOIN [Permit].[PermitPriority] pp ON u.Id = pp.UserId
INNER JOIN [Permit].[Permit] p ON pp.PermitId = p.Id
WHERE ut.[Name] = 'Employee' AND cf.[Name] = 'Hire Date' AND u.Email NOT LIKE 'admin@%') wl
GROUP BY wl.RequestByName
```
Thank You
Chaminda

data.Title: AdHoc getting started example.
data.Content:
Good morning. or maybe afternoon by you guys) 
I am really impressed with your EasyQuery product and I have really appreciated you sponsoring of a license (without support) for our project. I unfortunately need some serious assistance and have therefore purchased a basic license this morning so that I can get support.
I am trying to add the AdHoc functionality to my project and I have a couple of question and would really appreciate some help.
I am using thje ASPNet Zero framework (based on the abp.io framework).
In startup Configure I have addeed the follwing code as per you example
```
app.UseEasyQuery(options => {
        options.Endpoint = "/api/easyquery";
        options.UseDbContext<reedisaDbContext>();
        options.UsePaging(25);
    });
```
a) can you please explain the function of the endpoint option and where does it get used in my code (or is it only for your code)
b) the options.UsePaging statement says that UsePaging is not defined (i have checked and it appears that i have all the required packages installed) what am i missing or has this been deprecated.
c) my biggest problem is this: 
Aspnet Zero uses a factory and injection to create the dbcontext., so there is no 
```
            services.AddDbContext<reedisaDbContext>()
```
statement in Configure. When EasyQuery tries to use the context the systems fails as it has not been created. 
What would my best strategy for getting the context to EasyQuery,. I do not really want to use the database directly and to have to create a model of the database manually as it is quite large and complicated..
Your downloadable example for adhoc report does not have a controller like the data filtering one does, how do i het the adhoc page to show?
Sorry for being so stupid, please help. Thanks a lot.
Christiaan Krause (chris@reedisa.co.za)

data.Title: Switching Column Order Changes SQL Query Joins
data.Content:
Hello,
      I am finding a bug in the editor, when I change order of columns it completely changes query results. I was expecting changing column order should just change the column order and keep the query same.. 

Ex:

```
SELECT a.column1, b.column2 from tablea a left outer join tableb b on a.id = b.id right outer join tablec c on a.id = c.id right outer join tabled d on c.id = d.id
```
above query produces the result, my issue is when i change column order query changes to 

```
SELECT b.column2,a.column1 from tableb b left outer join tablea a on a.id = b.id left outer join tablec c on a.id = c.id right outer join tabled d on c.id = d.id
```
i was hoping changing the column would use same query with column placed differently in the result set.. Is this the desired behavior, i can clear see in the SQL query panel its being switched.
Please advise, this is high priority for us.

data.Title: Double quotes included by Language Manager instead of empty line with line breaks
data.Content:
Hi!
We updated KLIB component not so long ago and right before our product release we found out  that KLIB Language Manager works somehow incorrect.
The Language Manager when we call it using command line includes 2 double quotes instead of empty line with line breaks.
Just an example. Here is the original text from Native / English:
"Can not copy the database backup file into:
```
%s
```
Please, check media acessibility"
Here is what we got for English (same thing for other languages):
"Can not copy the database backup file into:
""""                                                                             <<< as you can the 2 double quotes appears here
```
%s
```
""""                                                                             <<< and here
Please, check media acessibility"
Same thing for Russian:
"Невозможно скопировать сохраненные файлы базы данных в:
""""                                                                             <<< as you can the 2 double quotes appears here
```
%s
```
""""                                                                             <<< and here
Проверьте доступ к медиа"
We have lots of similar cases (> than 25 places/resource strings) throughout all of our product localization. And we have no such issues before!
I'll attach screenshots for the case later.
KLIB version is latest downloaded from site.
Language Manager version is 4.15.0.9.
The command line is: "C:\Dev\trunk\Components\KLIB\localizer\langmngr\langmngr.exe" -export:all ..\stpass.ntv.lng -outdir:. -cfg:$(ROOT)\localizer.cfg
The contents of localizer.cfg file is:
```
[Import] 
SyncBy=1
```
ChangeTranslated=1
[Export] 
Delimiter=Comma
IncludeID=0
IncludeStringID=0
```
IncludeNames=1
```
Translated=1
Untranslated=1
Untranslatable=1
```
Encoding=2

data.Title: Data Filtering and Ad Hoc Report
Pressing enter after clicking on RemoveReportButton opens more prompts.
data.Content:
Our testers have found another one.
We changed the menu to buttons in the Ad Hoc Reporting example.  Delete is handled using your default handling of #RemoveReportButton.
When you click on the button it gets focus.  Subsequently hitting enter presses the button and opens additional prompts.  All prompts have the name of the current report.
Clicking OK on the top prompt removes the current report.  Clicking Ok on the next prompt removes the next report, not the one who'se name is displayed and so on and so forth.

data.Title: Export Issues
data.Content:
I'm seeing a few issues with the exporting functionality in EasyQuery
ISSUES 1 & 2 (Exporting from Excel and CSV):
1.	CR’s – Carriage returns are stripped in MS Excel whereas they are preserved in CSV export
2.	Unicode – Unicode data is lost in CSV export while it is preserved in MS Excel
Issue 3 (Opening exported Excel file)
An error always comes up in the newer Excel because the output format is “xls” and not “xlsx”.  Is there any way to get xlsx files to export?
Not an issue, but a question or enhancement request:
Is there any way to control formatting on the exported Excel output including the ability to exclude the "Report Title Header" and identify the row to “freeze panes” below the headers, and turn on filters automatically for all headers?  This is not needed but would be nice for sure for my application's implementation.

data.Title: Bool type conversion issue
data.Content:
We are seeing an issue, where boolean type condition in the query is interpreted true as 1 and false as 0. This behavior fails to execute the query with conversion error.
SELECT "keywords"."crash_key" AS crash_key, "keywords"."date_of_crash" AS date_of_crash, "HSIP19_Alldata"."ACCD_LOC_RMK" AS ACCD_LOC_RMK, "HSIP19_Alldata"."REF_POST_NUM" AS REF_POST_NUM, "crash_location"."city_code" AS city_code, "HSIP15_Alldata"."INJRY_SEV_CDE" AS INJRY_SEV_CDE, "HSIP19_Alldata"."ACCD_SEV_CDE" AS ACCD_SEV_CDE, "HSIP19_Alldata"."TOT_INJRD_ACCD" AS TOT_INJRD_ACCD, "HSIP19_Alldata"."TOT_FATLTY_ACCD" AS TOT_FATLTY_ACCD, "HSIP19_Alldata"."FHE_CDE" AS FHE_CDE, "crash_location"."city_id" AS city_id
```
FROM (((((("internal"."keywords" AS "keywords"
     LEFT OUTER JOIN "static"."tlk_counties" AS "tlk_counties" ON ("keywords"."county_id"  = "tlk_counties"."id" ))
     INNER JOIN "internal"."HSIP19_Alldata" AS "HSIP19_Alldata" ON ("HSIP19_Alldata"."CNTY_CDE"  = "tlk_counties"."name" ))
     INNER JOIN "internal"."HSIP15_Alldata" AS "HSIP15_Alldata" ON ("HSIP19_Alldata"."ACCD_KEY"  = "HSIP15_Alldata"."ACCD_KEY" ))
```
     FULL JOIN "internal"."reports" AS "reports" ON ("keywords"."id"  = "reports"."keywords_id" ))
```
     FULL JOIN "internal"."ndot_crash_report" AS "ndot_crash_report" ON ("reports"."crash_report_id"  = "ndot_crash_report"."id" ))
     FULL JOIN "internal"."crash_location" AS "crash_location" ON ("crash_location"."id"  = "ndot_crash_report"."crash_location_id" ))
WHERE
(
```
  (("HSIP19_Alldata"."ST_PPT_DMG_S" <> 1) OR ("HSIP19_Alldata"."ST_PPT_DMG_S" IS NULL)) )
In above query (("HSIP19_Alldata"."ST_PPT_DMG_S" <> 1) we select true or false in view designer but query is created as integer.. Is there a way we can convert this to bool for the query to work. 
We verified the data model and its bool type. not sure what's wrong to interpret the query as int.
Please advise.

data.Title: Issues with ClosedXML Exporter
data.Content:
Hello - I wanted to point out two issues I found with the new ClosedXML exporter.
1. If the query name is the default [New query] and you export, you get an error about the file name not being able to include characters like [ ] in it.
2. I have currency fields in my model, but they are exported as string fields in the xlsx file.  This prevents us from being able to apply a currency formatting ( e.g. $###.## ) unless we convert each field to a number.  
In the previous html exporter, these issues did not exist. I've stuck with using the old exporter for now until the new exporter reliably behaves the same as the old. Thank you!

data.Title: Ability to modify joins after Query has been built
data.Content:
Hi! I'm looking for a way to examine/modify the joins of a DbQuery after it has been built. My scenario is that a path to the tables is found correctly by EasyQuery, but I would like to add a condition to the Join statement in some instances after examining what tables were joined. For example, with this FROM clause generated by Eq: 
     FROM [Program] AS [Program] WITH ( NOLOCK )
     LEFT OUTER JOIN [Club] AS [Club] WITH ( NOLOCK ) ON [Program].ClubID  = [Club].ClubID 
```
     LEFT OUTER JOIN [Registration] AS [Registration] ON [Program].ProgramID  = [Registration].ProgramID 
     LEFT OUTER JOIN [Player] AS [Player] ON [Club].ClubID = [Player].ClubID     
     LEFT OUTER JOIN [PlayerRegistration] AS [PlayerRegistration] ON [Registration].RegistrationID  = [PlayerRegistration].RegistrationID 
```
I'd like to modify the last Join to PlayerRegistration as follows:
```
    LEFT OUTER JOIN [PlayerRegistration] AS [PlayerRegistration] ON [Registration].RegistrationID  = [PlayerRegistration].RegistrationID AND [PlayerRegistration].PlayerID = [Player].PlayerID
```
I am sort of able to do this by putting the that additional statement into the Where clause, but that changes the desired behavior of the LEFT JOIN by removing Player records that don't have a PlayerRegistration record. I tried using a Builder Tuner to accomplish this, but looking at the source code it appears the Tuners are applied before the Query statement is built. Is there currently a way to accomplish this?

data.Title: How to add a custom expression in a condition?
data.Content:
Hello! I'm trying to give the users the ability to create a custom expression in their condition.  Here's what they're trying to accomplish:
```
select * from claim where claim.net_incurred >= (policy.retention_amount / 2)
```
I've learned how to make custom operators from here (https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/how-to/field-to-field-comparison) and I suppose I could probably make a custom operator for "half of the right expression" (e.g. {expr1} >= ({expr2}/2) ), but that's not very flexible at all.  There's a few problems with this approach.  
1. to make the custom operator, I have to do it for all operator types - < > = != >= <=.  
2. I have to apply that operator to every single entity attribute that might use it 
3. I would have to create the custom operator for every operator type *and* every possible value (e.g.  {expr1} >= ({expr2}/2,  {expr1} >= ({expr2}/3,  {expr1} >= ({expr2}/4)
When selecting columns, the users have the ability to write in an expression.  Could this be applied to the Conditions as well?  If so, could the expression reference virtual attributes as well?  Thanks!

Have tried https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/api-reference/korzh-easyquery-db/korzh-easyquery-db-namespace/sqlformats-class

-UseAsInFrom

```
am not able to get it to work in v7 as the v7 builder is not placing brackets around the sub query like v5 use to. Please advise?

data.Title: aggregate question
data.Content:
Good evening,
We've got everything working in our project and so far we are very happy with the product. I did have a couple of questions regarding aggregates.
Can you aggregate based on groups? Lets say you want to see sum of sales within the past 3 years, summed by year, which should result in 3 rows, one per year. Is this possible? 
Also, is it possible to query based on part of a date? In the same example above, let's say I had a date field and I wanted to have a sum of sales data per month based on that date field. Is it possible to only group by the month part of the date? Or would you have to just split out the date into day, month, year in the data model?
I see the doc for having and groupby in the generated query but I don't think it applies to what I'm looking for.
thanks

Secutix Team

data.Title: Problem with export templates
data.Content:
Hello,
I am working on a new interface for my application and installing the latest version of korzh easy query for asp.net core.  In my old interface that will eventually be retired, we are using version 5 and it is running well.  The new interface is .net 6.  I'm not sure if this could be the cause of the issue.
I was running through the getting started tutorials again in order to implement the latest version.  I kept everything at the defaults and attempted to access the /EasyQuery/AdvancedSearch default view.  When I do, the page stops rendering before everything loads.  An inspection of the developers console in chrome shows an error roughly at line 190 of the AdvancedSearch.js file that is generated.  If I change up my configurations, the line number changes slightly. 
The js error indicates an unexpected "&" in the file.  Tracing it further, I see the serverExporters being added to options in the load event listener.  The array should be an array of strings but seems to be as: serverExporters: ['pdf','excel','excel-html','csv']    with ' being code for the apostrophes that should be around the strings.
I have tried disabling enable export on the advanced search page, changing the export formats (tried pdf, excel, "", string.empty, null, etc and none work).
Is this possibly caused by using .net 6 instead of 5 or is there something else I should be doing?  This is the only instance in the advancedsearch.js file that I've seen this happen.  other string arrays seem to be loading fine.

data.Title: BDS 2006 translation problem
data.Content:
I am using Delphi BDS 2006 and I wanted to translate my Polish .dfm forms to English code page .dfm forms.
Additionaly, I wanted to add some chinese characters using unicode coding. Unfortunately BDS .dfm forms does not
support unicode standard and instead the special characters are used with # mark such as #26102.
When I use Korz localizer with Delphi BDS 2006 to translate my Polish .dfm forms I get following results:
1. for English-Chinese text: "时间组长度 group length of time" I get incorrect translation 
```
Caption = '????? group length of time'
```
2. for English-Chinese text: "时间背景长度 background length of time" I get correct translation 
```
Caption = #26102#38388#32972#26223#38271#24230' background length of time'
```
Correctly 2. and incorrectly 1. translated texts are in the same .dfm file.
What should I do to get correct translations such as in 2. using Korzh localizer?
Thank you for your help in advance.
Best regards,
Adam

data.Title: Columns in child tables display wrong values
data.Content:
When there is a relationship between tables, the referencing column values display wrong values. In order to put conditions on the referenced columns, the user needs to go to the parent table to pick values, because the lists on the child column displays different/random values. 
eg. Table A  has column1 and column2 and Table B has column1, column2 and column3 where column1 has foreign key relationship from Table A
If a user tries to query Table B and put condition for Column1 and clicks on (select value), the values in column1 displays wrong values or some random column value from TableA. So in order to put condition the user should column1 values from Table A, but the user should be able to select from Table B itself.

data.Title: Various Export issues - Blazor Client
data.Content:
Hello,  The testers have picked up various 'minor' issues with the aggregations export process as follows:
Issue 1: In the image attached, notice that Access Code report exported have not values for grouped columns. These values are in result table.
Issue 2:  The total number i.e., 7 below a group is confusing as the aggregation can have numeric values. (Possibly needs highlighting)
Issue 3: First record in the export has group column values.
Issue 4: Text Total is displayed, this is not present in the Result table.
Issue 5: Serial number is not in the export but not sure this is required. Serial number is in the Result table.
Issue 6: Only Result table is exported. Pivot table data is not being exported.
The attached image may help visualize the issues.
NB, Please investigate what needs to be resolved. Is there a parameter to hide the left numeric column from the screen output widget?
Many thanks
NB Hope you, your family and colleagues stay safe during this difficult time. Best Wishes and luck...
