data.Title: Node JS
data.Content:
Hello,
At the Greenwood Genetic Center we are interested in this product.  We have a working EasyQuery JS Community version working.  I'm struggling figuring out what our next step is.  We are interested in the EasyReport Starter Kit (ERSK) as it appears to have more functionality allowing for teams and individuals to be able to save reports rather than all be shared.  It seems I read that it can work without having to create a Data Model which would be nice.
I do not see a Node version of this but it said it would be available over a year ago.  I've tried installing the Core Solution but am not as familiar with that as I am with JS.  I would appreciate if someone could call me or help me out as we are close to ready to purchase the version allowing us to host on-premise.  But we need to be able to test and ensure it does everything we need on our system
My cell phone number is +18649803119
Thank you,
Charles Angel

data.Title: Can't export query results - no changes were made
Is there a way to order the table relationships?
data.Content:
I have a table that links Transaction to Product.
This table is called "TransactionProduct"
The TransactionProduct table also has links to other tables like "Membership".
TransactionProduct also has a link to the Customer table, so does the Membership Table.
Membership also has a link to Product. (some TransactionProduct entries are generated based on the Membership Table, using product and customer - these IDs are stored in the TransactionProduct table for being able to run reports later.).
Is there a way to order or prioritise the links in the table, so that if an EasyQuery is made with just the TransactionProduct table and Customer in it, that it chooses to link to the Transaction table first, before it chooses another table like Membership?

data.Title: Session ID in easy query JS inbuilt request APIs
data.Content:
Hello,

Is there a way we can add values in request header or query in inbuild API requests?
APIs like:
```
GET /models/{modelId}
POST /models/{modelId}/queries/{queryId}/sync
POST /models/{modelId}/queries/{queryId}/execute
GET /models/{modelId}/valuelists/{editorId}
POST /models/{modelId}/queries/{queryId}/export/{format}
```
I looked into https://korzh.com/easyquery/docs/how-to/easyquery-middleware-non-authenticated-users but not able to find a solution.

data.Title: EasyQuery Model
data.Content:
Hi,
We are encountering an issue with the DataModel Editor 7.0 for EasyQuery.
When we attempt to edit the Data Model in our project and save it without making any changes, we notice that the output is different. The size of the new data model file is smaller. In addition:
Some parameters are missing, even though we have not made any changes. 
We also note that there are different parameters and XML file structure.
We are not confident that we can use this data model editor to make any changes to the data model file given these differences.
We believe this might be because we are using a newer version of the Data Model editor. 
Could you provide some information as to why this is happening? Should we seek to locate an earlier Data Model Editor to avoid these unintended file changes?
You can see the new version of the file has been reorganised for example the "editors notes" kept together while in the earlier file it is kept closer to the Attr nodes. See screenshot example attached.
Our goal is to make changes to the Data Model without changing the XML structure. Any assistance you can give will be appreciated.

```
string userName = context.User.FindFirst(ClaimTypes.NameIdentifier)?.Value;
```
Or
```
string userName = context.User.Identity.Name
```
On our other non EasyQuery API calls, we can always get logged in user's name this way. Is there anything we should be doing to enable this for the EasyQuery API?

data.Title: Easy query concurrent update error
data.Content:
Hello, we've been seeing this error in production and think it might be an issue within EasyQuery. We are currently using version EasyQuery for .NET Core version 7.2.0, and using .NET 6.0.1.
The error:
Operations that change non-concurrent collections must have exclusive access. A concurrent update was performed on this collection and corrupted its state. The collection's state is no longer correct.
```
at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.FindValue(TKey key)
at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.TryGetValue(TKey key, TValue& value)
at Korzh.Utils.TextStorageMap.GetStorage(String storageId)
at Korzh.EasyQuery.DataModel..ctor()
at Korzh.EasyQuery.Db.DbModel..ctor()
at Korzh.EasyQuery.Services.EasyQueryManagerSql.CreateModelCore(String modelId)
at Korzh.EasyQuery.Services.EasyQueryManager..ctor(EasyQueryOptions options, IServiceProvider services)
at Korzh.EasyQuery.Services.EasyQueryManagerSql..ctor(EasyQueryOptions options, IServiceProvider services)
```
Do you have any ideas what this is?

data.Title: ERSK Pro EasyReport
data.Content:
Hello,
I am interested in ERSK Pro but before to buy I wanted to ask some questions to know will it be suitable for our company.
We have DB with Views. User can create his own reports using Visual query builder. User does not know the connection to DB and should not see it. When user opens Visual query builder he should see only views according to his permissions, not all the views. Each view has OrgID field. User can see only data related to his organization. Views have relations and they should be predefined, user should not create  relations. User can create grids and charts. My questions are:
1. Is it possible to integrate ERSK Pro with existing SQL Server DB, use AspNetUsers table and others?
2. Is it possible to filter visible Views(Tables) in Easy query builder depending on current user?
3. Is it possible to filter data in Views(Tables) depending on current user, apply hidden filters, for example set OrgID=50?
4. Is it possible to predefine relations between views and if needed edit relation type by user in Easy query builder?
Thanks

data.Title: Blazor Wasm - Access Response Headers?
data.Content:
Hello,
We need to inspect the response from the server when it comes back to the client, from an EQ-generated call. Our Blazor WASM website uses token-based authentication and sometimes the refreshed auth token gets sent to the client when an EQ-generated request is made. Client-side, we need to inspect that response and pull out the new auth token.
I see your examples on GitHub (https://github.com/easyquery/DotNetSamples/blob/master/AspNetCore/Blazor/AdHocReporting.BlazorWasm/Client/wwwroot/js/eq.blazor.js) showing how to attach authorization tokens:
```
     >>>>    http.defaultHeaders['Authorization'] = 'Bearer ' + viewOptions.token;
```
which we use, thanks for that - but I don't see any sort of examples / documentation on handling/inspecting the response.
Thanks,
```
Jeremy

data.Title: How to filter a custom expression column
data.Content:
I have the following query generated with EasyQuery:

```
SELECT claim.claimnumber
       AS
       ClaimNumber,
       claim.claimantlastname
       AS ClaimantLastName,
       claim.claimantfirstname
       AS ClaimantFirstName,
       claim.claimantmiddleinitial
       AS ClaimantMiddleInitial,
       ( Isnull(claim.expenseincurred, 0)
         + Isnull(claim.indemnityincurred, 0)
         + Isnull(claim.medicalincurred, 0) ) +
       Isnull(claim.recoveryreceived, 0) AS
       NetIncurred,
       policy.retentionamount
       AS RetentionAmount,
       CASE
         WHEN ( Isnull(claim.expenseincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.indemnityincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.medicalincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.recoveryreceived, 0) ) >=
              ( policy.retentionamount / 2 )
       THEN 'Yes'
         ELSE 'No'
       END
       AS "Past Half Retention",
       CASE
         WHEN ( Isnull(claim.expenseincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.indemnityincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.medicalincurred, 0)
                + Isnull(claim.recoveryreceived, 0) ) >= policy.retentionamount
       THEN
         'Yes'
         ELSE 'No'
       END
       AS "Past Full Retention"
FROM   (dbo.claim AS Claim
        INNER JOIN dbo.policy AS Policy
                ON ( claim.policyid = policy.id ))
WHERE  ( policy.isselfadministered = 1
         AND NOT ( claim.claimstatusid IN ( 1, 4 ) ) ) 
```

It uses two custom expressions and I need to add a filter where "Past Half Retention" is Yes.  How would I go about doing that?

data.Title: Question about which license to purchase or renew
data.Content:
Hi,
A few years ago we developed an application using EasyQuery with a backend ASP.NET & WCF service targeting .NET Framework 4.7.2 and a front end Web application using JavaScript with Angular version 10. Since our EasyQuery license has expired, we would like to renew or purachse a new license. I believe what we need to renew or purchase is the "EasyQuery for ASP.NET Team license." My understanding is that the "EasyQuery for ASP.NET Team license" includes "EasyQuery.JS library" needed for the front end application.
Where I am confused is on the distinction between Core vs. Not Core. "EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core Team license"
On my dashboard I only see the Core edition listed (i.e., the "EasyQuery for ASP.NET Core Team license").
Since, our application is not a core aplication because we are still using .NET Framework 4.7.2, I believe we should purcahse the plain ASP.NET without the core.
Does this sound correct?
The license keys we have hard-coded in our C# application are the following:
```
            Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.License.Key = "w5T2jSxvpyT39qaz5N6wegGBP921ZI";
            Korzh.EasyQuery.AspNet.JSLicense.Key = "AlzWbvUgrkISH9AEAEoV7wBKJXGX14";
```
I don't know which license our license keys came from, and if that license is recoverable.
Cynde Carley who is listed as the license owner on the licenses on my dashbaord no longer works for Thomson Reuters.
Would it be possible to transfer the ownership of those licenses to be under my name?
If we discover we purchased the wrong edition (ASP.NET Core), can we transfer the license to the edition that we need (e.g., ASP.NET)?
Or is it possible to use an ASP.NET Core license with a non Core application.
It sounds to me like we might need to purchase a new license.
What are your thoughts on this?
Thanks,
Gregory Riggs
gregory.riggs@thomsonreuters.com
```
Lead Software Engineer

data.Title: Add new operator for text field
data.Content:
Hi all,
We have requirement from our clients to add several operators:
1. Less than ( < )
2. Greater than ( > )
3. Ends with ( '%xx' )
```
4. Is empty ( COALESCE(fieldname, '') = '' )
```
The reason for 1 and 2 is, some times data is in text but actually have sequence pattern for example PO Number e.g. PO-000123.
With "less than" and "greater than" operator, client will be able to narrow down the search range.
For 3, we see that there's already "starts with", so "ends with" will be a nice complement
For 4, some times submitted text field is not null but empty string, so it will be ideal id we have this operator as well.
All of operators above can be translated to SQL syntax without issue.

data.Title: Use EasyQuery with entity Framework request unnecessary join between 2 tables

I have 2 tables that are not connected, and EasyQuery is requesting that these tables are connected. When I don't connect them I get an error: {"result":"error","message":"Cannot find a path between tables \".ReportingCalculatedLead\" and \".ReportingCalculatedContact\""}
Sometimes we have data that don’t require connection between these 2 tables, and on these times no data is displayed.
We are using:
.Net Core for the backend and Angular for the front end
And this happened when we are using the AddSimpleCondition
```
                    manager.Query.ExtraConditions.AddSimpleCondition("TenantId", "Equal", tenantId);
```
The TenantId property is available in every table.
Thanks in advance for the help.

data.Title: Problem with "Today"
data.Content:
We have a problem with a report with a date “Within Today”. When it is scheduled to run at 11:55PM it returns no results, but when run the report during the day it returns correct results. 
I have verified this and confirmed that by 11:45PM the report is running on the next day - suspect a daylight savings time issue. The report should have queried 1/18 - 1/19 but did 1/19 to 1/20 instead. 
Setting the scheduled report to run early the next morning as a workaround to report on the day before is not possible because “Yesterday” or “In the Last” are not options in the Report builder.  There is no physical way to do a report for the last 24 hours.

data.Title: The order of table joins depends on the sequence of columns
data.Content:
Hi EasyQuery team,

We are looking for a third-party ad-hoc reports solution for our application. Now we are trying to create a prototype with your application and it is pretty fit for us.

At this moment we have a few questions with which we rely on your help (in this request I will describe the problem, additional requests will be created for other questions)

** The Issue description **
We noticed that the sequence of columns generates different results. For example, we have the following structure: 
Payroll entity with relationships: Payroll Check (many) and Company (one),
Payroll Check entity: Employee (one), Tax (many) 
Employee: Company (one)

I'm trying to create a report with just 3 columns: Employee Name, Tax.Name, Tax.Amount, and a few conditions by company name, payroll date and employee name.
Depending on the position of the Employee Name table I get different results:
1.  **Employee Name**, Tax.Name, Tax.Amount
The SQL script:
```sql
SELECT [EmployeeReportView].[Full Name] AS "Employee Full Name", [PayrollTaxesView].[Name] AS "Payroll Taxes Name", [PayrollTaxesView].[Amount] AS "Payroll Taxes Amount" 
FROM (((([PayrollTaxesView] AS [PayrollTaxesView]
     INNER JOIN [PayrollCheckReportView] AS [PayrollCheckReportView] ON ([PayrollTaxesView].PayrollCheckId  = [PayrollCheckReportView].PayrollCheckId ))
     INNER JOIN [EmployeeReportView] AS [EmployeeReportView] ON ([PayrollCheckReportView].UserProfileId  = [EmployeeReportView].UserProfileId ))
     INNER JOIN [CompanyReportView] AS [CompanyReportView] ON ([EmployeeReportView].CompanyId  = [CompanyReportView].CompanyId ))
     INNER JOIN [PayrollReportView] AS [PayrollReportView] ON ([PayrollReportView].CompanyId  = [CompanyReportView].CompanyId ))
WHERE
(
  [CompanyReportView].[Name] LIKE '%8348%' AND 
  [PayrollReportView].[CheckDate] BETWEEN '2022-12-01 18:41' AND '2022-12-01 18:42' AND 
  [EmployeeReportView].[Last Name] LIKE '%1121%' ) AND (
  [CompanyReportView].[ResellerId] = 8346 )
ORDER BY 1 OFFSET 0 ROWS FETCH NEXT 1000 ROWS ONLY
```

2. Tax.Name, Tax.Amount, **Employee Name**
```sql
SELECT [PayrollTaxesView].[Name] AS "Payroll Taxes Name", [PayrollTaxesView].[Amount] AS "Payroll Taxes Amount", [EmployeeReportView].[Full Name] AS "Employee Full Name" 
FROM (((([PayrollTaxesView] AS [PayrollTaxesView]
     INNER JOIN [PayrollCheckReportView] AS [PayrollCheckReportView] ON ([PayrollTaxesView].PayrollCheckId  = [PayrollCheckReportView].PayrollCheckId ))
     INNER JOIN [EmployeeReportView] AS [EmployeeReportView] ON ([PayrollCheckReportView].UserProfileId  = [EmployeeReportView].UserProfileId ))
     INNER JOIN [CompanyReportView] AS [CompanyReportView] ON ([EmployeeReportView].CompanyId  = [CompanyReportView].CompanyId ))
     INNER JOIN [PayrollReportView] AS [PayrollReportView] ON ([PayrollCheckReportView].PayrollId  = [PayrollReportView].PayrollId ))
WHERE
(
  [PayrollReportView].[CheckDate] BETWEEN '2022-12-01 18:41' AND '2022-12-01 18:42' AND 
  [EmployeeReportView].[Last Name] LIKE '%1121%' AND 
  [CompanyReportView].[Name] LIKE '%8348%' ) AND (
  [CompanyReportView].[ResellerId] = 8346 )
ORDER BY 1 OFFSET 0 ROWS FETCH NEXT 1000 ROWS ONLY
```

The only difference between sql queries is in the last INNER JOIN. But only the second option is correct.
I think I can resolve this issue by removing separate Company entity and add the company name separately to the Employee and Payroll entities. But I'm wondering if you know how to fix this in another way.

I will be grateful for your help.

-------
Best regards,
Anastasiya Shapoval

data.Title: Grouping by date field doesn't work
data.Content:
Hello,

Could you please help me with the grouping by date field?

I have the following report settings:
Columns: Payroll.Company Payroll Id, Payroll.Check Date, Employee Full Name
Aggregations: [Payroll Company Payroll Id] ::: <Employee Full Name (Count)>
Conditions: Payroll Check Date within 12/1/2022 8:36:00 PM and Today

Which gives me a query
```sql
SELECT [PayrollReportView].[Company Payroll Id] AS "Payroll Company Payroll Id", [PayrollReportView].[CheckDate] AS "Payroll Check Date", [EmployeeReportView].[Full Name] AS "Employee Full Name"
FROM (([PayrollCheckReportView] AS [PayrollCheckReportView]
     INNER JOIN [PayrollReportView] AS [PayrollReportView] ON ([PayrollCheckReportView].PayrollId  = [PayrollReportView].PayrollId ))
     INNER JOIN [EmployeeReportView] AS [EmployeeReportView] ON ([PayrollCheckReportView].UserProfileId  = [EmployeeReportView].UserProfileId ))
WHERE
(
  [PayrollReportView].[CheckDate] BETWEEN '2022-12-01 20:36' AND '2023-02-06 00:00' )
ORDER BY "Payroll Company Payroll Id" OFFSET 0 ROWS FETCH NEXT 1000 ROWS ONLY
```

And results that you can see in the screenshot aggregation_by_payrollId.png

When I add to the group the Payroll Check Date, I get really weird results for me, because expected to get the same result.
Aggregations: [Payroll Company Payroll Id, Payroll Check Date] ::: <Employee Full Name (Count)>
Results at the screen aggregation_by_payrollId_and_date.png

Interesting, that the query stays the same. So I can suppose that issue is somewhere in the entity settings. 
For the data model, I'm using the EF core and the entity with the date field described with the following code:
```c#
 public class PayrollReportView
    {
        public int PayrollId { get; set; }
        public string CompanyPayrollId { get; set; }
        public DateTime CheckDate { get; set; }
    }
```
Maybe I need to do some additional settings?
Also, I'm wondering how can I show only a date part in the results (format "mm/dd/yyyy").

data.Title: EasyQuery Clickable URL Field
data.Content:
Hi all,

I see that in EasyQuery Advanced Search I can modify the field expression as long as the underlying database supports it.

data.Title: Marketing collaboration | TutorialsEU
data.Content:
Hello Korzh Team!
My name is Liza and I am the Team Assistant at TutorialsEU. Nice to e-meet you! 
We at TutorialsEU, a programming education brand based in Germany, have a growing YouTube channel that focuses on videos about C# and .NET for experienced developers.
I came across your company and EasyQuery tool and immediately saw a nice overlap between your audience and our channel’s audience.
We would like to provide you with reach to target your ideal customers by doing a short 30-second shoutout on one of our upcoming videos. We believe that shoutouts will be great for generating awareness and leads for your products and introducing new audiences to your brand, as well as an excellent opportunity for us to establish new collaborations.
Here are some stats about our channel:
Our total amount of subscribers on YouTube → over 5600k (rapidly growing a C# .NET programming audience)
Our average amount of views per YouTube video → 1.5k views within 30 days (some peaking at 15k views)
Our upvote rate is 99%-100% and the average number of likes per video is 30
Our audience stats provided by YouTube: 96% male and almost 90% are 18 - 45 years old
Our audience countries of viewers: US, UK, Germany, etc.
In exchange for the shoutout, we are asking for a sponsorship fee. This is a valuable opportunity for both of our companies, and we would be honored to have you as a sponsor.
If you are interested in this opportunity, please let me know. We would be happy to get into more details or jump on a call. 
Thank you for your time and consideration and I look forward to hearing from you.
Best regards, 
```
Liza Cheremisina
TutorialsEU
